full_summary:
===============

## 2 New Floating Wharves Installation, Chance Harbour, St. John County, New Brunswick

## Project Overview

The government of Canada invites proposals from qualified contractors to install 2 new floating wharves at Chance Harbour, located in St. John County, New Brunswick. The objective of this project is to supply and install 2 new floating wharf structures anchored on steel guide pipe piles filled with concrete, parallel to the existing infrastructure.

## Specifications and Drawings

The project scope of work includes, but is not limited to:

* Supply and installation of 2 new treated timber floating wharves anchored to steel guide pipe piles filled with concrete
* Removal and disposal of all existing timber sheathing, fender piles, ladders, and wales
* Supply and installation of new timber sheathing, fender piles, ladders, and wales
* Mobilization and demobilization of all necessary equipment to facilitate project progress

## Contract Details

* Contract duration: 1 year, expected start date November 6, 2023, and expected end date October 21, 2024
* Evaluation criteria: Lowest Price
* Tender closing date: November 1, 2023, at 14:00:00
* Tender status: Expired

## Eligibility and Requirements

* Eligible bidders must be registered in the suppliers database
* Bidders must provide proof of financial resources, technical capacity, and relevant experience
* Contractors must demonstrate compliance with environmental and health and safety regulations

## Notice Documents and Attachments

The notice documents and attachments can be accessed at the following URL: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/20972/30004822---ift-specifications--chance-harbour-st.-john%2C-nb-%28en.pdf> 

## Contact Information

For more information, please contact Tammy O'Toole, Fisheries and Oceans Canada, at:
* Email: [tammy.otoole@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:tammy.otoole@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
* Telephone: (343) 550-1758
* Address: 200, Kent Street, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0E6, Canada
